@jordanoverbye Thank you for submitting this PR! I see this is your first time submitting to DefinitelyTyped üëã ‚Äî I'm the local bot who will help you through the process of getting things through.

***This is a live comment which I will keep updated.***

## 1 package in this PR

* `apollo-upload-client` (*new!*) ‚Äî [on npm](https://www.npmjs.com/package/apollo-upload-client), [on unpkg](https://unpkg.com/browse/apollo-upload-client@latest/)

## Code Reviews

This PR adds a new definition, so it needs to be reviewed by a DT maintainer before it can be merged.

You can test the changes of this PR [in the Playground](https://www.typescriptlang.org/play/?dtPR=46191&install-plugin=playground-dt-review).

## Status

 * ‚úÖ No merge conflicts
 * ‚ùå Continuous integration tests have failed
 * üïê Only a DT maintainer can approve changes when there are new packages added

Once every item on this list is checked, I'll ask you for permission to merge and publish the changes.

<!--typescript_bot_welcome-->

Hey @jordanoverbye,

:unamused: Your PR doesn't modify any tests, so it's hard to know what's being fixed, and your changes might regress in the future. Please consider [adding tests](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#user-content-adding-tests-to-a-new-package) to cover the change you're making. Including tests allows this PR to be merged by yourself and the owners of this module.

***This can potentially save days of time for you!***
<!--typescript_bot_suggest-testing-->

üîî @jordanoverbye ‚Äî there are no owners, but it would still be good if you find someone to [review this PR](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/46191/files) in the next few days, otherwise a maintainer will look at it. (And if you do find someone, maybe even recruit them to be a second owner to make future changes easier...)
<!--typescript_bot_pinging-reviewers-others-->

@jordanoverbye The CI build failed! Please [review the logs for more information](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/commit/3cc81dbde57a1b0eda6f69f539fa49b8d420adff/checks?check_suite_id=938074936).

Once you've pushed the fixes, the build will automatically re-run. Thanks!

**Note: builds which are failing do not end up on the list of PRs for the DT maintainers to review.**
<!--typescript_bot_gh-actions-complaint-3cc81db-->
